chargeHist.descr: Child Sexual Exploitation - Videos, Records, etc.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Sexual Exploitation - Videos, Records, etc., a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.05(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
FORTHWITH
Consecutive to: any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo AODA and any counseling/treatment per agent.  Continue sex offender treatment.  No contact with children under the age of 18 unless supervised by an adult approved by the DE's agent.  No contact with Dale and Dalton Barton, Sue Biesek and Anthony Long.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.

Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises Atty Kelly filed motion to withdraw, defense does not object.  Court approves same.  Atty Martinez advises factual problems/corrections to PSI.  Pg. 4, 15, 24, 25, 28, 29, 30, 32, 37 & 40.  State makes argument.  State requests court follow the DOC recommendation of 10 years IC/8 years ES and all conditions in PSI.  Court notes DOC recommends concurrent, State leaves that to Court's discretion.  Atty Martinez calls Lisa Andreas - S&T.  State cross exams.  State calls Nicole Belk - S&T.  Atty Martinez cross exams.  Recess at 10:03.  Back on at 10:15 a.m.  Atty Martinez makes argument.  Atty Martinez requests 3 years probation or impose and stay a prison sentence.  DE makes statement.  Court imposes sentence.

WI State Prison for 8 years (5 years Initial Confinement/3 years Extended Supervision), consecutive to any other sentence

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on December 11, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on January 22, 2018 at 09:00 am.

(Day three) On the record w/the jury at 9:08 a.m.  Court reads instructions to the jury.  Parties have sidebar w/the Court.  State does closing argument.  Recess briefly at 9:36 a.m.  Jury back in at 9:41 a.m.  Atty Martinez does closing argument.  State does rebuttal argument.  Court finishes reading instructions to jury.  Clerk calls number of alternate juror to be stricken.  (#7)  Jury goes to deliberate at 10:23 a.m.  Court asks parties if there are any objections to the instructions as read.  Court notes error as to reading of #2121.  Atty Martinez notes objections he made while doing sidebar that he did not mention in front of the jury.  State responds/disagrees.  Court responds.  Recess at 10:29 a.m.  Back on the record at 10:53 w/a question from the jury.  Court notes jury has requested additional copies of #2121.  Parties have no objection.  Back off the record at 10:54 a.m.  Back on the record at 12:25 p.m.  Court states the two newest questions by the jury re: reviewing the video and the ability to pause and watch video from closer.  Court notes parties have moved screen closer to jury box and jury will be brought in and sit wherever they wish in the jury box to view the video twice and then returned to the jury room to continue deliberations.  Parties will not be allowed to say anything while jury is in here.  Jury back in at 12:30 p.m.  Court advises jurors to sit or stand wherever they need to to watch the video again.  Video shown two times in a row to the jury.  Jury back out w/o discussion at 12:34 p.m.  State notes that video was played fully two times w/o pausing.  Atty Martinez agrees.  Recess again at 12:35 p.m.  Back on the record at 12:57 pm.  Foreperson of the jury states they have reached their verdict and hands both verdict forms to the Court.  Court reads the verdict - Guilty.  Court polls the jury.  All agree w/guilty plea.  Court thanks the jury and gives final instructions.  Jury excused at 1:01 pm.  State moves for entry of judgment of conviction.  Atty Martinez objects.  Court grants motion and enters judgment of conviction of guilt to the charge.  Matter will be set for sentencing.  PSI to be ordered so sentencing will be 60 days or so out.  PSI to be completed no later than 1/15/2018.

(Day two) Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez and attorney Tom Kelly.  Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin w/Ct Officer Stacy McClure SCSD.  Court notes the sequestration order applies to all persons who are on one side or the other of the case...or both sides.  Cautionary instruction will not be given during the trial until the end when all other instructions are given.  Jury in at 9:07 a.m.  State calls S.B. - S&T.  State shows exhibits 9 and 10 to witness.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Jury out at 9:19 a.m. so Atty Kelly can question the Court re: cross-exam.  Atty Kelly addresses civil suit filed by S.B. against DE that she collected money on.  State objects that being brought up in front of the jury.  Parties argue.  Court will allow Atty Kelly to provide offer of proof.  Atty Kelly questions witness.  Exhibit #31 marked and ID'd.  State makes objection.  Court overrules.  Atty Kelly continues questioning witness.  State asks questions of witness.  State makes argument.  Atty Kelly responds.  Court will not allow testimony as to possible law suits.  Jury back in at 9:33 a.m.  Atty Kelly does cross-exam of S.B.  Atty Kelly shows witness exhibit #20.  Jury out at 9:51 a.m. for Atty Kelly to address another matter w/the Court.  Atty Kelly addresses an offer of proof re: a fraudulent claim.  State responds.  Parties argue.  Court will not allow this line of inquiry at this time and cites deadline for other acts.  Jury back in at 9:56 a.m.  Atty Kelly finishes cross.  State does re-direct.  Witness excused.  State calls Det. Sgt. Eric Miller - SCSD - S&T.  Witness ID's exhibits 1-19.  Court receives 1-19.  State publishes 1-19 w/"Elmo".  Witness ID's #20.  Court receives #20.  Witness ID's #21.  Court receives #21.  Witness ID's #22.  Court receives #22.  Recess for morning break at 10:27 a.m.  Back on the record w/the jury at 10:50 a.m.  Atty Kelly does cross-exam of Sgt. Miller.  State does re-direct.  Witness excused.  State calls Det. Stacy McClure - SCSD - S&T.  Witness ID's #23.  Court receives #23.  Witness ID's #30.  Court receives #30.  Witness ID's #24.  Atty Kelly objects.  Court receives #24 at this time and states any issues can be discussed at a later time.   State shows #24 on the big screen to the jury in several segments along w/testimony from Det. McClure.  Court takes break for lunch now at 11:52 a.m.  Court asks parties to be back by 12:45 p.m.  Back on the record w/the jury at 1:00 pm.  Atty Kelly does cross-exam of Det. McClure.  Video clips 94-100 played by Atty Martinez.  Exhibit #32 marked and ID'd.  State does re-direct.  Witness excused.  Court takes short recess at 1:31 pm.  Jury back in at 1:37 pm.  State calls Timothy Lokrantz - DCI - S&T.  Exhibit #25 marked and ID'd.  Court receives #25.  Witness ID's #24, #26.  Court receives 24 and 26.  State plays part of exhibit #24.  Witness ID's #27.  Court receives #27.  State plays another portion of #24.  Atty Kelly does cross-exam.  Witness excused.  State calls Larry Flessert - DOJ - S&T.  Exhibit #28 ID'd.  Court receives #28.  State plays clip #1 from exhibit #24.  State plays clip #5 from exhibit #24.  Atty Kelly does cross-exam.  Witness excused.  Recess at 2:32 pm.  Back on the record at 2:46 pm.  State rests and Atty Kelly states they have no testimony.  DE agrees he will not testify.  Court questions DE re: his decision not to testify/accepts that decision is freely made and the Court considers the evidentiary portion of the testimony completed.   Jury in at 2:51 pm.  Court advises the jurors that the State is resting their case and as well is the defense.  Court advises jury that the evidentiary evidence is closed as of now and they are excused until 8:45 tomorrow morning for closings and instructions.  Jury excused at 2:54 pm.  Recess to do instructions at 2:55 pm.  Back on the record at 3:26 pm.  Court takes argument and makes ruling on DE motion to modify standard instruction #140.  Atty Martinez makes argument for motion.  Court makes clarification as to what they feel should be changed.  State argues against modification.  Atty Martinez responds.  Court notes he is on the jury instruction committee in the intereset of full disclosure.  Court denies the motion and explains why.  Court is in recess at 3:41 pm.  Back on the record at 4:45 pm.  Court reads over agreed instructions.  Parties agree to remove "sexual intercourse" and change to the victim's name at the very top of the page on #3.  "The person" should be substituted w/the victim's name.  #4 also needs the victim's name.  Parties agree.  #465 address - remove "optional short form".  Remove "Augustus" on the not guilty form.  Recess at 4:57 pm.

(Day one) Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez and attorney Tom Kelly.  Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in custody does not appear yet.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin as well as Ct Officer Det. Stacy McClure - SCSD.  Court states case and appearances and goes on the record to clarify the clothing the DE will wear today.  Atty Kelly states DE has civilian clothes available for the jury trial today.  Atty Martinez agrees.  Atty Kelly addresses what DE is intending to wear today.  Court responds re: civilian clothes.  Court goes off the record for clothes to be brought to DE.  Back on the record at 8:54 a.m.  DE now appears in person in civilian clothing.  Court notes DE appears in appropriate clothing and readdresses what he said yesterday re: applicable rule SCR62.02.  Atty Kelly displays trousers that DE wants to wear for the JT.  Court states they look like prison garb and stands by his earlier ruling.  Atty Kelly makes argument.  State responds.  Court stands by his ruling earlier and expects the DE to follow his orders.  Court address jury draw.  Five strikes each so 23 jurors to be called up and there will be one alternate.  Note taking will be allowed but no questions from the jury.  Court notes one juror was excused late in the day yesterday due to illness.  Off the record for housekeeping issues at 9:10 a.m.  Back on the record at 10:05 a.m.  Court addresses questions they are to ask of the jurors.  Notes some questions that will be asked in the jury room as opposes to in the court room.  Off the record at 10:08 a.m.  All potential jurors in at 10:25 a.m.  Court introduces court personnel to the jury and begins opening instructions.  All potential jurors sworn.  Court begins voir dire and introduces parties to the jury.  Off the record at 10:47 a.m. to do individual voir dire.  Back on the record at 11:49 a.m.  Court addresses jury and clerk calls the next three names.  Court continues voir dire by asking questions of three new names just called/all 3 answer no to questions already asked.  Court continues voir dire of all jurors.  Court addresses possible issue w/juror #2.  Juror #2 excused by Court and next juror called.  #12 knows one of the names mentioned at the start of the trial today.  State does voir dire.  #7, #11, #12 are excused.  Clerk calls three new jurors.  Court asks questions of those three.  #29 is excused and clerk calls next juror #31.  Court asks questions of that juror.  State continues voir dire.  #29 struck and #32 called.  #22 struck and #33 called.  State continues voir dire.  Atty Martinez makes objection.  Court sustains objection.  State continues voir dire.  Court takes short recess at 12:31 pm.  Court advises parties to break for lunch at 12:40 p.m.  1:20 pm - Parties do individual voir dire of one of the jurors.  Juror not excused.  Back on the record at 1:28 pm.  Atty Kelly addresses issue w/victim witness coordinator.  Asks the Court to admonish that person not to do that.  State requests clarification.  Court addresses issue.  Jury back in at 1:38 pm.  Atty Martinez does voir dire.  Atty Martinez requests that #25 be excused.  Court excuses #25 and clerk calls #34.  Court questions #34.  Atty Martinez continues voir dire.  Parties begin strikes at 2:50 pm.  Final 13 jurors names called and all are sworn.  Court begins final instructions to jury at 3:10 pm.  Back on the record at 3:30 pm.  State notes issue w/juror #34 was resolved w/o individual voir dire.  Nothing further to note before going back on the record w/the jury.  Court asks bailiff to pay specific attn to #33 in case he needs assistance.  Back on the record w/the jury at 3:33 pm.  State does opening statement.  Atty Martinez does opening.  Court advises jury to report to Br 3 jury room at 8:45 tomorrow w/a 9 a.m. start time.  Court advises jury of instructions again.  Jury out at 3:50 pm.  Atty Martinez notes his request made to the Court earlier re: the DE's current placement.  Court responds that it's not relevant.  Recess at 3:53 pm.

Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in court with attorney Tom Kelly and attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Court notes motions filed late on Friday are being addressed today.  DE motion to allow cross-exam of S.B.'s prior convictions.  Atty Kelly filed the motion but has nothing to add.  State asks barring of use of these for considerations and explains why.  Atty Kelly responds.  Court denies motion and explains why.  Court addresses other acts motion as to the use of criminal conviction of DE for first degree sexual assault.  State responds.  Atty Kelly responds.  State responds.  Court satisfied by State's offer and this would be admissible in the Court's view.  State can offer it.  Atty Kelly's motion to bar convictions if DE would testify.    Atty Kelly addresses 901.04.  State responds.  Atty Kelly responds.  State notes prior convictions were addressed in her motion filed on 9/5/2017 in paragraph 4.  Atty Kelly argues briefly re: old convictions.  State responds.  Court states the four offenses named are major crimes and would be considered as prior convictions should the DE testify.  State questions whether D.J. would be testifying as an expert or not.  Atty Kelly states they are not obligated to disclose that.  Court questions whether opinions requiring expertise would be solicited.  State requests D.J. be barred as a witness.  Court notes D.J. hasn't been identified as an expert so he's assuming she wouldn't be.  Atty Kelly notes they are providing a recorded interview that D.J. did w/the witness A.L..  State requests tape be barred as she hasn't received it yet and the JT is set for tomorrow.  Atty Martinez responds.  Parties argue re: witnesses.  Court states that if the tape if made available to the State this morning, barring some unforeseen circumstances at this time, the DE will be allowed to call these witnesses in question but not as expert witnesses as it's too late for that.  Parties discuss testimony expected by State's witnesses as to prior cases.  Court addresses copies of a late arriving jury questionaire and after that hearing the Court received another one.  Court notes parties did receive a copy of that questionaire.  Court agrees that all jurors should be present and there is no argument from the State.  Atty Martinez cites Estelle v. Williams as to DE attire for JT.  State's they are making the strategic decision to have DE appear for JT in his prison clothes and cites several cases that he says reflect his ability to do that if he so wishes.  State notes her concerns w/DE appearing in prison clothes.  Atty Martinez responds.  Parties discuss.  Court advises civilian clothing be available for trial tomorrow should he rule against DE.  Atty Kelly notes there is a different outfit he intends DE to wear tomorrow that is green and better fitting but says the jail won't give him access to them.  SR62.02 will be reviewed by the judge and he will let the parties know if his decision by 1pm hopefully.  Atty Martinez states there has been at least one other case allowed in Wisconsin in Milwaukee Co.  Court notes parties should be here by 8:30 tomorrow and notes jurors will be in the basement of the west square building and brought in after the first names are called and placed in the jury box.  Court notes he will communicate his decision on the clothing business and if necessary address that tomorrow.
Motion hearing on November 6, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Trial Brief to Bar Prior Convictions
Defendant's Trial Brief to Bar Evidence of Sexual Assault Conviction
to Allow Cross-Examination of Sue Biesek's Prior Convictions

Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez and Tom Kelly.  Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE's motion to bar video evidence.  Court orders counsel and DE to view the videos either at the jail or in another private location, perhaps a jury room, if the jail does not work.  Atty Hoffman address clothing for DE for trial.  Atty Kelly objects as no motion has been filed by State.  Court expects DE to have some civilian clothes ready.  Court questions DE regarding civilian clothes - free, knowing and voluntary.  DE wishes to preserve the right to wear his prison clothes.  State inquires as to witness list for experts.  Atty Kelly will advise court tomorrow by 4 p.m.
Motion hearing on November 2, 2017 at 10:00 am.
to Bar Video Evidence - Discovery Violation by State
Witnessed Signature of Additional Discovery Exchange

Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez and Thomas Kelly.  Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE's motion for reconsideration considering jurors that were excused at the last hearing and reverse ruling on excusing any jurors.  State requests motion be denied to ruling already made.  Court denies the motion.  State's motion to exclude witnesses and physical evidence.  Atty Kelly objects to the motion.  Court directs 1 or more reasonable accesses to the tapes and directs the state to inquire with DCI as to whether it can be done there.  Court directs the State to contact DCI and make arrangements for counsel to view the videos and advise counsel when they can be there.  Court directs that the DE does not need to be present for the viewing of the videos.  Court permits viewing of the videos two times.  Atty Kelly to disclose to State and court by no later than Friday, November 3, 2017, if they intend to have a witness at trial.  Motion to compel discovery.  State to follow the protective order on clips 93-100.  Atty Martinez requests protective order be amended to allow him to save a copy to his hard drive in the event an expert is retained and needs to view the files.  State objects.  State to make 2 copies and both copies are to be returned to the State.  Motion to modify criminal jury instruction 140.   Court is reviewing it and will give a decision.  State addresses subpeona re: Det. McClure and evidence she is required to bring.  Atty Kelly responds and will be more specific when he can be.  Court asks whether DE has rec'd all police reports starting in 2006.  Atty Kelly acknowledges he's rec'd those.  Court questions what else he's talking about other than paper documents.  Atty Martinez responds re: what property was seized.  State says 50-100 items on seizure list.  Atty Kelly notes they would want the camera and any other equipment these videos came from.  Court advises parties to be reasonable and suggests that list be narrowed by Friday.  Atty Kelly suggests Monday morning before noon.  Nothing further.  Court addresses clothing for the DE.  Atty Martinez states they have nothing yet and Atty Kelly would chose not to address that at this time.  State questions how DE will be dressed for JT.  Court states he cannot force DE to appear in non-prison garb but states that would be a choice the DE would make after being advised.  Court won't address the restraint issue as that is left up to court security.  Court is in recess at 4:37 pm.
State's Brief in Response to DE's Motion to Modify JI 140
from Atty Kelly to Judge Reynolds
to Compel Discovery of Physical Evidence

Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez and Tom Kelly.  Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 4:16 On the record.  Court takes up motion to compel discovery or bar state witness that was filed by defense.  Atty. Kelly states defense hasn't recv'd any discovery on 2 of the witness'.  Atty. Hoffman makes argument on witness'.  Atty. Martinez makes argument on address' and not the victim.  Court orders State on request of defendant to make L.F.M. and S.B. available for defense/defense investigators. Good cause shown that retired professionals don't need address and other is connected to victim.  No prosecutors to be present but a victim witness coordinator could be there with S.B.  Atty. Kelly came to DA's office on 10/11/17 and looked at file.  State will provide 2 witness' reports as Atty. Kelly pays for that.  Atty. Kelly concurs.  Court goes over jurors that are excused B.A., M.B., R.C., N.L. & M.W. from the questinnaires.  Parties wish to argue serveal others T.B. - State states to be excused based on answers & biases.  Atty. Martinez argues. Court excuses T.B. Parties argue over L.B. answers - Court keeps her on panel.  Next H.B. - State argues to close to defendant.  Atty. Martinez argues.  Court keep on panel.  Next is G.F. - State argues about law enforcement and opinion on charges.  Atty. Martinez believes bring in and question.  Court allows on panel and be reconsider if submission on law on a juror withholding/lying about information.  Next is P.M. - State argues can't remain impartial.  Atty. Martinez argues.  Court allows on panel.  Next is D.P. - State argues about anger against law enforcement.  Atty. Martinez argues.  Court excuses from panel.  Next is A.P. - State argues about being impartial.  Court allows on panel.  Next is D.P. - State argues about being a convicted felony.  Atty. Martinez argues.  Court allows on panel.  Atty. Kelly wishes to have copies of the discs that Court ordered could be used.  State makes argument on that.  Atty. Kelly sites 971.23(1)(bm).  State argues for motion from defense on videos.  Court sets for continued hearing.  Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in court with attorney Thomas J Kelly.  Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Court notes matter set today for hearing more on State's Motion re: other acts.  Court notes he did review the 11 proposed video clips referred to in State's motion.  State explains why they feel the clips should be included.  Atty Kelly responds against.  State responds.  Parties argue.  Parties discuss times of clips.  Court notes possible issue w/clips as to local locations and possible prejudice.  State responds.  Atty Kelly responds.  Court grants the State's motion as to clips 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 9, 10.  All of those meet criteria for Sullivan analysis.  Court explains why he has chosen the clips he has.  Recess for 10 minutes at 3:41 pm.  Back on the record at 3:53 pm.  Court will address the journal next.  State makes statement.  Atty Kelly responds.  State responds.  Court grants the State's motion and again explains why.  Court then addresses the judgement of conviction on 1st degree sexual assault.  State responds briefly.  Atty Kelly has no argument.  No argument concerning surrounding facts.  Parties respond briefly.  Court grants motion as to those acts.  Atty Kelly notes State wishes to offer JOC for 1st degree sexual assault under 904.04(2b) and jury instruction 276.  They are objecting to that.  State requests clarification.  Parties discuss.  Court notes the statute in question wouldn't apply here.  Atty Kelly then questions further re: prior conviction.  State responds.  Parties discuss.  Court grants State's motion and reference to JOC will be allowed assuming sufficient foundation.  Other acts is then taken care of.  Court states there is also Mr. Kelly's motion that came in 10/18/2017.  Motion to bar any state witnesses that are not specifically named w/current address, etc.  State notes DE will be held here in Sauk Co and not returned to prison over the weekend.  Requests clarification if Daubert hearing is still necessary on two witnesses.  Atty Kelly states that is not necessary.  Court will continue matter to next Monday 10/23 at 2:30 pm.
to Compel Discovery or Bar State Witnesses

Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in court with attorney Thomas J Kelly.  Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's Motion to admit other acts.  Atty Kelly objects to the motion.  Court grants the motion for extension of time to file the motion.  Court wishes to view the recordings as well as the defense.  Court proposes the State disclose by October 5, 2017, the precise recordings that is the subject of the other acts motion.  Motion to admit other acts reset.  Court grants the extension for filing of the Motion in Limine.  Court grants the motion in paragraph 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7.  Court denies the memorandum of law in support of motion to suppress.  Court grants the motion regarding to Prohibit Opinion Testimony as to Content of Video.  Court directs that the State follow the statute regarding analyst names and reports/summary and CV by no later than October 16, 2017. to court of Appeals for leave to appeal a nonfinal order of the circuit court file by atty. Ruby

Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in court with attorney Thomas J. Kelly.  Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  DE  motion challenging the bind over to be heard today and also set for arraignment today.  State states their position in re: to the motion.  Atty Kelly responds.  Court denies motion on all grounds.  Atty Kelly requests arraignment be reset.  State takes no position on arraignment but notes that on 10/30/2015 that counsel acknowledged rec. information.  Court resets arraignment.  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in court with attorney Thomas J. Kelly.  Defendant Charles Augustus Clayton-Jones in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin w/SCSD Det. Stacy McClure.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  State calls Det. Stacy McClure - SCSD - S&T.  Atty Kelly does cross-exam.  State does re-direct.  Atty Kelly does re-cross.  Witness excused.  State rests.  Atty Kelly has no evidence.  State moves for bind over.  Atty Kelly makes argument.  State responds.  Court finds probable cause and binds over.  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
